summary: This article discusses the relaunch of Maer Roshan's Radar magazine, which is backed by Mort Zuckerman and Jeffrey Epstein. It highlights the challenges faced in securing funding and the dynamics of the media industry, including previous failed ventures and negotiations.

persons.name: Maer Roshan
persons.context: Maer Roshan is the founder of Radar magazine, which is attempting a comeback with new financial backers.

persons.name: Mort Zuckerman
persons.context: Mort Zuckerman is a primary backer of the new Radar magazine and has previously been involved in media ventures with Roshan.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is a financial backer of the new Radar magazine alongside Mort Zuckerman.

persons.name: Doug Hand
persons.context: Doug Hand is the attorney who handled negotiations for Roshan with Zuckerman and Epstein.

persons.name: Maria Oufkin
persons.context: Maria Oufkin is a French Moroccan businesswoman who briefly engaged with Roshan for backing but faded from the scene.

persons.name: Nick Denton
persons.context: Nick Denton is mentioned in relation to a controversial incident at the Radar launch party.

persons.name: Suzanne Boyd
persons.context: Suzanne Boyd is noted as an editor who attended the Radar launch party.

connections.description: Roshan and Zuckerman are collaborating on the relaunch of Radar magazine.
Roshan and Epstein are both primary backers of the new Radar magazine.
Doug Hand represents Roshan in negotiations with potential backers.
Zuckerman and Epstein are financial backers of Radar magazine.
Denton and Roshan interacted at the Radar launch party, which included a controversial incident.

events.title: Radar Magazine Relaunch
events.description: Maer Roshan's Radar magazine is set to relaunch with new financial backing from Mort Zuckerman and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Radar Magazine Launch Party
events.description: The launch party for Radar magazine was marked by a controversial incident involving Nick Denton.

keyFacts: Maer Roshan's Radar magazine is attempting a comeback with financial backing from Mort Zuckerman and Jeffrey Epstein.
Previous attempts to secure funding for Radar faced challenges, including failed negotiations.
The launch of Radar magazine is planned for April 2005, with expectations of significant financial commitment.
Nick Denton was involved in a controversial incident at the Radar launch party, which included being pied.
Doug Hand is the attorney representing Roshan in negotiations with potential backers.
